div.p: When I first went to Secondary School I went to a Grammar School and I got in a few bit of trouble for the first year,
a lot of fights and stuff I was getting in so my parents moved me after the first year. School is one of those things that if I could
do it again I don’t know maybe I’m the only one that thinks like this but you know sometimes you think imagine you could relive time
or do school again or imagine you could look like you’re 14 and do school all over again because I’d do it totally differently
because my experiences at school weren’t all that great, I was always sort of like it’s a sort of cliché but you know everyone always
says they were bullied at school and stuff like that... Yeah I was, school for us it was sort of rough but it was good at the same time
so you know I was one of the only ones with dreadlocks at the time so I stood out so not only was I dealing with standing out amongst
say English and Caucasians because I was black but I was also different to, you know, to black people as well because I had locks
so that was seen as a bad thing as well whereas now if I’d go to school right now this is like the latest fashion so I’d be like the cool kid
in school, it’s just why I want to do it all again but yeah that’s, school is hit and miss I had good moments I had bad moments
but then every kid does. Back in Year 8 I did drama for the first time and it was just one session I remember acting was nothing I was
ever even thinking about or anything like that it wasn’t in my vision I’d never experienced anything to do like that before
so we’re doing an hour class and we’re adlibbing and acting little parts out and she was like “you’re quite good at this,
you’re quite good at acting” and I was like “oh, OK” went back to the next session, did drama again and she was like
“no, they’re doing some drama group and some auditions at a local television centre do you want to try for that?”
I tried and I got in first time and that’s one of the first things I tried and got in straight away and I just enjoyed it ever since
so I would say that encouraged me to look past the norm, back then as well you don’t have a lot of role models to look up to
I mean there’s no solicitors, no doctors living in my area so I didn’t really have that to look up to so seeing a different,
experiencing something different, outside my normal scope at the time yeah so I enjoyed it and that encouraged me to look at different things
rather than things I’d never thought of before
